definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]

sentences.english: Among all the bridges, the most popular among tourists are the hanging bridges.
sentences.chinese: 在所有的桥中，最受旅游者欢迎的就是绳索吊桥。

sentences.english: Hearing the wheels on the drawbridge, Puss in Boots hastened out.
sentences.chinese: 听见吊桥上车轮的声音，穿靴子的猫急忙跑了出来。

sentences.english: Once the drawbridge is down, what happens next is up to you.
sentences.chinese: 吊桥一倒，便是你大展宏图之时。

sentences.english: The Brooklyn Bridge is one of the oldest suspension bridges in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克林大桥时美国最古老的吊桥之一。

sentences.english: we came across this footbridge where these children were carrying flour.
sentences.chinese: 我们在过吊桥时遇到的汲水的孩子。

sentences.english: On the eastern span, officials decided to build a suspension bridge with a complex design.
sentences.chinese: 政府官员决定在东面修建一座设计复杂的吊桥。
碧潭情人吊桥，踩船，散步。

sentences.english: Mr. Su has sold cotton candy at the Bitan Bridge for 38 years.
sentences.chinese: 苏先生在碧潭吊桥附近卖棉花糖已经有38年了。

sentences.english: This is the famous suspension bridge on the Tagus.
sentences.chinese: 这是塔古斯河上有名的吊桥。

sentences.english: Doudou looked like an American soldier in World War 2.
sentences.chinese: 豆豆过吊桥时象二战中解放世界的美国女兵。

sentences.english: Please keep a firm grasp on the cable when crossing the drawbridge.
sentences.chinese: 过吊桥的时候请大家用手抓紧绳缆。

sentences.english: The local authorities decided to build a suspension bridge over the river.
sentences.chinese: 该地区政府决定在这条河上建一座吊桥。

sentences.english: Think parachute cords and suspension bridge cables.
sentences.chinese: 试想一下另外如降落伞绳索和吊桥上的绳索。

sentences.english: The movable part of a drawbridge.
Most drawbridges worked using two long pieces of wood.
sentences.chinese: 大多数吊桥依靠两根长木头来收放。

sentences.english: The bridge is wide enough for only one person to pass at a time .
sentences.chinese: 你正穿过一座吊桥，桥宽仅容一人通过。

definition: plank walkway constructed on the face of a cliff/(archaic) elevated passageway connecting the upper levels of adjacent towers
rope tackle hanging from a mast/crow foot (system of ropes through tackle to hold up an awning)
enceinte of a city gate/barbican entrance to a city
Muzha (old spelling: Mucha), suburb to the southeast of Taipei
cheval de frise (a type of barrier)
